meanings.definition: A body of men in Anglo-Saxon England who were liable for military service.
meanings.sent1: The fyrds were called upon to serve their country in times of need.
meanings.sent2: The king relied on the fyrds to protect the kingdom from invaders.
meanings.sent3: The fyrds gathered with their weapons, ready to defend their land.
meanings.sent4: The fyrds stood like a shield around the kingdom, ready to fight any threat.
meanings.sent5: The image of the fyrds marching into battle is etched in history.

meanings.definition: The military forces of a nation or kingdom.
meanings.sent1: The fyrds were well-trained and disciplined soldiers.
meanings.sent2: The fyrds assembled on the battlefield, ready for combat.
meanings.sent3: The fyrds celebrated their victories with great feasts.
meanings.sent4: The fyrds moved like a powerful force, unstoppable in their advance.
meanings.sent5: The fyrds' banners fluttered proudly in the wind as they marched.
